Events.text: Pope Innocent IV arrives at Lyon for the First Council of Lyon
Events.html: Pope Innocent IV arrives at Lyon for the First Council of Lyon

Events.text: The University of Leipzig opens.
Events.html: The University of Leipzig opens.

Events.text: St Paul's Cathedral is consecrated in London.
Events.html: St Paul's Cathedral is consecrated in London.

Events.text: Dedication of the Touro Synagogue, in Newport, Rhode Island, the first synagogue in what will become the United States.
Events.html: Dedication of the Touro Synagogue, in Newport, Rhode Island, the first synagogue in what will become the United States.

Events.text: The USS Alfred becomes the first vessel to fly the Grand Union Flag (the precursor to the Stars and Stripes); the flag is hoisted by John Paul Jones.
Events.html: The USS Alfred becomes the first vessel to fly the Grand Union Flag (the precursor to the Stars and Stripes); the flag is hoisted by John Paul Jones.

Events.text: At Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, Napoleon Bonaparte crowns himself Emperor of the French.
Events.html: At Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, Napoleon Bonaparte crowns himself Emperor of the French.

Events.text: War of the Third Coalition: Battle of Austerlitz: French troops under Napoleon Bonaparte decisively defeat a joint Russo-Austrian force.
Events.html: War of the Third Coalition: Battle of Austerlitz: French troops under Napoleon Bonaparte decisively defeat a joint Russo-Austrian force.

Events.text: Monroe Doctrine: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President James Monroe proclaims American neutrality in future European conflicts, and warns European powers not to interfere in the Americas.
Events.html: Monroe Doctrine: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President James Monroe proclaims American neutrality in future European conflicts, and warns European powers not to interfere in the Americas.

Events.text: Manifest destiny: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President James K. Polk proposes that the United States should aggressively expand into the West.
Events.html: Manifest destiny: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President James K. Polk proposes that the United States should aggressively expand into the West.

Events.text: Franz Joseph I becomes Emperor of Austria.
Events.html: Franz Joseph I becomes Emperor of Austria.

Events.text: French President Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte overthrows the Second Republic.
Events.html: French President Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte overthrows the Second Republic.

Events.text: Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte becomes Emperor of the French as Napoleon III.
Events.html: Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte becomes Emperor of the French as Napoleon III.

Events.text: Militant abolitionist leader John Brown is hanged for his October 16 raid on Harpers Ferry, West Virginia.
Events.html: Militant abolitionist leader John Brown is hanged for his October 16 raid on Harpers Ferry, West Virginia.

links.title: John Brown's raid on Harpers Ferry

Events.text: At Tremont Temple in Boston, British author Charles Dickens gives his first public reading in the United States.
Events.html: At Tremont Temple in Boston, British author Charles Dickens gives his first public reading in the United States.

Events.text: Philippine–American War: The Battle of Tirad Pass, termed "The Filipino Thermopylae", is fought.
Events.html: Philippine–American War: The Battle of Tirad Pass, termed "The Filipino Thermopylae", is fought.

Events.text: Puyi becomes Emperor of China at the age of two.
Events.html: Puyi becomes Emperor of China at the age of two.

Events.text: World War I: Russia and the Central Powers sign an armistice at Brest-Litovsk, and peace talks leading to the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk begin.
Events.html: World War I: Russia and the Central Powers sign an armistice at Brest-Litovsk, and peace talks leading to the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk begin.

Events.text: Following 19 years of Ford Model T production, the Ford Motor Company unveils the Ford Model A as its new automobile.
Events.html: Following 19 years of Ford Model T production, the Ford Motor Company unveils the Ford Model A as its new automobile.

Events.text: Great Depression: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President Herbert Hoover proposes a $150 million (equivalent to $2,150,000,000 in 2016) public works program to help generate jobs and stimulate the economy.
Events.html: Great Depression: In a State of the Union message, U.S. President Herbert Hoover proposes a $150 million (equivalent to $2,150,000,000 in 2016) public works program to help generate jobs and stimulate the economy.

Events.text: New York City's LaGuardia Airport opens.
Events.html: New York City's LaGuardia Airport opens.

Events.text: World War II: During the Manhattan Project, a team led by Enrico Fermi initiates the first artificial self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction.
Events.html: World War II: During the Manhattan Project, a team led by Enrico Fermi initiates the first artificial self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction.

Events.text: World War II: A Luftwaffe bombing raid on the harbour of Bari, Italy, sinks numerous cargo and transport ships, including the American SS John Harvey, which is carrying a stockpile of World War I-era mustard gas.
Events.html: World War II: A Luftwaffe bombing raid on the harbour of Bari, Italy, sinks numerous cargo and transport ships, including the American SS John Harvey, which is carrying a stockpile of World War I-era mustard gas.

Events.text: Jerusalem Riots of 1947: Riots break out in Jerusalem in response to the United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine.
Events.html: Jerusalem Riots of 1947: Riots break out in Jerusalem in response to the United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine.

links.title: United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine

Events.text: Korean War: Battle of the Ch'ongch'on River ended, with decisive Chinese victory, UN forces were completely expelled from North Korea.
Events.html: Korean War: Battle of the Ch'ongch'on River ended, with decisive Chinese victory, UN forces were completely expelled from North Korea.

Events.text: Cold War: The United States Senate votes 65 to 22 to censure Joseph McCarthy for "conduct that tends to bring the Senate into dishonor and disrepute".
Events.html: Cold War: The United States Senate votes 65 to 22 to censure Joseph McCarthy for "conduct that tends to bring the Senate into dishonor and disrepute".

Events.text: The Sino-American Mutual Defense Treaty, between the United States and Taiwan, is signed in Washington, D.C.
Events.html: 1954 – The Sino-American Mutual Defense Treaty, between the United States and Taiwan, is signed in Washington, D.C.

Events.text: The Granma reaches the shores of Cuba's Oriente Province. Fidel Castro, Che Guevara and 80 other members of the 26th of July Movement disembark to initiate the Cuban Revolution.
Events.html: The Granma reaches the shores of Cuba's Oriente Province. Fidel Castro, Che Guevara and 80 other members of the 26th of July Movement disembark to initiate the Cuban Revolution.

Events.text: In a nationally broadcast speech, Cuban leader Fidel Castro declares that he is a Marxist–Leninist and that Cuba is going to adopt Communism.
Events.html: In a nationally broadcast speech, Cuban leader Fidel Castro declares that he is a Marxist–Leninist and that Cuba is going to adopt Communism.

Events.text: Vietnam War: After a trip to Vietnam at the request of U.S. President John F. Kennedy, U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mike Mansfield becomes the first American official to comment adversely on the war's progress.
Events.html: Vietnam War: After a trip to Vietnam at the request of U.S. President John F. Kennedy, U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mike Mansfield becomes the first American official to comment adversely on the war's progress.

Events.text: The United States Environmental Protection Agency begins operations.
Events.html: The United States Environmental Protection Agency begins operations.

Events.text: Abu Dhabi, Ajman, Fujairah, Sharjah, Dubai, and Umm al-Quwain form the United Arab Emirates.
Events.html: Abu Dhabi, Ajman, Fujairah, Sharjah, Dubai, and Umm al-Quwain form the United Arab Emirates.

Events.text: Laotian Civil War: The Pathet Lao seizes the Laotian capital of Vientiane, forces the abdication of King Sisavang Vatthana, and proclaims the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
Events.html: Laotian Civil War: The Pathet Lao seizes the Laotian capital of Vientiane, forces the abdication of King Sisavang Vatthana, and proclaims the Lao People's Democratic Republic.

Events.text: Fidel Castro becomes President of Cuba, replacing Osvaldo Dorticós Torrado.
Events.html: Fidel Castro becomes President of Cuba, replacing Osvaldo Dorticós Torrado.

Events.text: Salvadoran Civil War: Four American missionaries are raped and murdered by a death squad.
Events.html: Salvadoran Civil War: Four American missionaries are raped and murdered by a death squad.

links.title: 1980 murders of U.S. missionaries in El Salvador

Events.text: At the University of Utah, Barney Clark becomes the first person to receive a permanent artificial heart.
Events.html: At the University of Utah, Barney Clark becomes the first person to receive a permanent artificial heart.

Events.text: Benazir Bhutto is sworn in as Prime Minister of Pakistan, becoming the first woman to head the government of an Islam-dominated state.
Events.html: Benazir Bhutto is sworn in as Prime Minister of Pakistan, becoming the first woman to head the government of an Islam-dominated state.

Events.text: Canada and Poland become the first nations to recognize the independence of Ukraine from the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Canada and Poland become the first nations to recognize the independence of Ukraine from the Soviet Union.

Events.text: Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar is shot and killed in Medellín.
Events.html: Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar is shot and killed in Medellín.

Events.text: Space Shuttle program: STS-61: NASA launches the Space Shuttle Endeavour on a mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope.
Events.html: 1993 – Space Shuttle program: STS-61: NASA launches the Space Shuttle Endeavour on a mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope.

Events.text: The United Kingdom devolves political power in Northern Ireland to the Northern Ireland Executive following the Good Friday Agreement.
Events.html: The United Kingdom devolves political power in Northern Ireland to the Northern Ireland Executive following the Good Friday Agreement.

Events.text: Enron files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
Events.html: Enron files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

Events.text: San Bernardino attack: Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik kill 14 people and wound 22 at the Inland Regional Center in San Bernardino, California.
Events.html: San Bernardino attack: Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik kill 14 people and wound 22 at the Inland Regional Center in San Bernardino, California.

Events.text: 36 people die in a fire at a converted Oakland, California, warehouse serving as an artist collective.
Events.html: 36 people die in a fire at a converted Oakland, California, warehouse serving as an artist collective.
